main event: An F-86 pilot reported seeing a high-intensity red glow in the sky over Hokkaido, Japan on November 24, 1955.
interesting points: The object was initially seen as spherical but changed to an oblong shape while retaining brightness., The glow was stationary and disappeared gradually over a 5-minute observation period., The pilot reported the sighting at an altitude of 25,000 feet., The sighting was evaluated as possibly being a reflection of the moon through clouds., The object was visible for approximately 5 minutes, and the report contained no photographs.
sighted object: a high-intensity red glow in the sky
